website_summaries.verdict: Low priced hamburger patty press that can create three different types of burgers easily.
pros: This press works to make regular burgers, stuffed burgers, and sliders
Especially good for stuffed burgers, thanks to shape of the press
Allows you to create burgers of varying sizes, including some as large as three-quarters of a pound
All materials in this press are dishwasher safe, so cleanup goes fast
cons: Takes some trial and error to use it properly, as instructions are limited

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Basic design is fine, however the diameter is far too small. It's almost like the designers have never once cooked a burger. The inside diameter of the press is only 4 inches. By the time you cook them, they come out close to slider size. Can't imagine how small their slider size would end up. Silver dollar size perhaps? Again the design is fine, but the dimension should be roughly an inch larger. I'm sending it back. For reference the bun in the attached photo is just a standard white bread 3-3/4" bun.
customer_reviews.author: Darrow

customer_reviews.title: Great little gadget.
customer_reviews.text: Got it today and had a package of hamburger ready to go. I used an ice cream scoop and a little extra per burger. I used cellophane wrap and put it in the bottom then the burger then put the other end over the top and pressed the burger. Comes out all wrapped in cellophane wrap and put them in the freezer. Didn't even get my hands in the hamburger and the press was clean when I finished. Took about ten minutes to do the whole package. Great little gadget.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Top does not lock
customer_reviews.text: There are 2 very tiny tabs that lock the piece that makes the "cavity." Mine does not lock, so you cannot screw on the flat piece to pack them down. This led to my burgers not being packed enough and coming apart as soon as I tried to get them to turn! Can't believe the all the positive reviews, but if you look closely they mention flat top and cast iron which isn't even found on my 3 in 1 press. They must be lumping all of cuisianarts press in one review!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Makes small burger OK
customer_reviews.text: At first I expected a metal unit, this is all plastic. It comes completely apart for cleaning. I tried to press burgers with stuff inside, the burger did not hold together very well. ended up reducing the amount of fillers I put in it. The diameter is a bit smaller than I would like. Since the meat shrinks, the end product is smaller in diameter. The meat did stick, but since the bottom pushes out, it is easy to make the patties. Making thick burgers went well, just harder to cook all the way through, thus a larger diameter would work better. Over all, it is OK, works well, but may look for one larger in diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Cea JaysTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Yes it's another gadget but....
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy and fun to use! Plus it's easy cleanup and it takes up so little space. I highly recommend it. I made burgers with it and also sliders. One thing I didn't know is that you're not supposed to touch ground beef any more than necessary or it toughens it. I used to almost "knead" my ground beef, mixing in spices, etc. Now with this I just quickly put the meat in the press, then sprinkle Worcestire and seasoning on top of the burger, not touching it. They came out so much more tender.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I live in TX and I grill all year around. That said, I like the higher fat ground beef more than lean as it makes the patties stick better (not fall apart). The downside of higher fat ground beef is the fat/slime that cakes your hands when you make the patties by hand. Its takes a butter knife and several handwashings with Dawn to get it off. Gross! This thing solved that "problem" and makes a great patty in a variety of sizes. It also saves on prep time and washes easily in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: prodiver22

customer_reviews.title: Love my new perfectly sized burgers
customer_reviews.text: Hubby was not real thrilled when I decided to buy this item after watching someone in a video make a stuffed burger using one. He said his burgers were "just fine." Well, let me tell you, after the first use, he came inside while grilling and said "OK, so you were right. The burgers turned out perfectly sized and because they are all shaped evenly, they cook better and don't fall through the grates." I loved the fact that I could stick some cheese or olives in the middle of it and have a stuffed burger. Just buy it. I think you'll love your new burger patty maker!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca R.

customer_reviews.title: easier by hand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would help create a more uniform burger. We were having a graduation party and i thought this would be a great way to prep the food for ease of cooking. I got through a couple and quit using it. The hamburger 80/20 stuck horrible to the press. When trying to remove it, it ruined the round patty. I just went back to old school and rounded into a ball and hand flattened the meat.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have tried lots of styles of patty makers. I was using a cookie cutter for sliders and decided to try this out. Let me say, it makes great patties. The diameter and thickness are perfect for standard buns. As for the sliders, my only complaint is the the press doesn't fit in the slider "press" mold. So when I cook the sliders, they bloat. I'm going to use my lathe to make a press that fits the slider. I like the burger press so we'll I don't regret the purchase. But the slider maker didn't quite hit the mark.
customer_reviews.author: Juston

customer_reviews.title: He loves them!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband who loves grilling burgers. We always try to make our own burger patties since store bought ones always come out dry and lacks a bit of flavor for us. Unfortunately, no matter how hard you try to press them and shape them, they don't come out as nice as the store bought ones. They always come out uneven on the sides and bulging in the middle. This way, we can add whatever seasoning we want to our meat and shape them so they'll still look nice a professional. Overall, happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: yabaaz

customer_reviews.title: Not for sliders
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to make sliders for an outdoor party. I set up a “slider bar” with different toppings, breads, (you get th idea...) It might be a decent design for stuffed burgers, but the only thing that is useful for sliders is the little mold that comers with it. There is no actual press to mush the ground meat into neat and even little slider shapes. It was cheap and not worth returning, so I tossed it out. FYI: For my sliders, I put pre-cut hamburger paper (from Amazon) in a muffin tin and used a juice glass to mush them down. I should have thought of that first and saved a few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rich

customer_reviews.title: I like it! (less the stuffed feature... )
customer_reviews.text: Separating the stuffing indentor piece is more challenging than expected. Spin the top clockwise or counter as you lift it up. This will provide better results. Doesn't make stuffing burgers any less of a pain but it sure delivers a quality stuffed burger if your into that kind of effort. Grill the stuffed cap side first for 1/2 the amount of time you would need for an evenly heated piece. Else your cap will separate and your presentation will be no bueno.
customer_reviews.author: Amp

customer_reviews.title: Burger Mania
customer_reviews.text: Man, why didn’t I have one of these years ago? This is a great way to make stuffed burgs consistently. Burgers come out the same size every time, and I can stuff it with anything. It’s faster than trying to do one by hand, so nice to save some time, the priceless commodity. This unit works great, and will make sliders as well, though not stuffed. I believe these would work well on the International Space Station. You folks up there read amazon reviews? Try one.
customer_reviews.author: fourbyfive

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT BURGERS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS BURGER PRESS!!! I don't know why people use plastic wrap in them, I just place my meat directly into the molds and It comes out perfect! I threw them in my dishwasher for an easy and quick wash! I haven't tried to make stuffed burgers yet but the instructions that come are very clear. The burgers that I made were such a great thickness that they grilled perfectly and were juicy! I will never buy store bought burgers anymore. Homemade is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't help with stuffed burgers
customer_reviews.text: This press makes a fantastic burger patty, but it doesn't create a well sufficient enough for a stuffed burger. The piece that is supposed to press the well into the meat is too large in circumference and sticks to the meat, pulling the bottom of the patty up when you try to remove it, regardless of being coated in cooking spray. I've used the mold and hand pressed the meat around the sides and bottom and created stuffed burgers, but I could get the same results with a piece of parchment and a whiskey glass.
customer_reviews.author: StarGazer

customer_reviews.title: Makes Great 'Normal' Size Burgers!
customer_reviews.text: I don't intend to make stuffed burgers with the Cuisinart CSBP-100 Stuff Burger Press, and probably won't make sliders, either, but it's nice to know that if I wanted to, I *could*. I bought this because I've had previous burger presses that were far too wide for 'normal' burgers/burger buns (a 1/4 lb. of meat in my old press made a patty 1/4" thick and nearly 5" wide!... that's a pancake - what good is that?). This press makes good, regular sized burgers in a snap. I trust the Cuisinart brand will last me a long time. Happy with purchase. :)
customer_reviews.author: AvidproxyTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Great for making regular patties, stuffing burgers, not as much...
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a neat tool for making burgers. Here are some things I noticed: The patty can get stuck to the mold so be sure to line it with a bit of oil. When making stuffed burgers, you really can't put too much in the middle. Maybe a taller press is in order. Also, when stuffing burgers, keep in mind that your cook times will be different. Since there is only a thin layer of beef on each side now, it will cook very quickly. If you like making your own patties though, this is a must. They came out nice every time. Fresher and cheaper than buying frozen patties! Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: PWN

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart every time
customer_reviews.text: The top part of this burger press falls apart every time. For some reason, the top press is not a single shell design. It is made of two parts that are supposed to interlock. Unfortunately, they fall apart way to easily so that every time I press the burger, when I remove the top press, the bottom piece gets left behind, forcing me to dig it out. I attached a picture of the top press. (clue: It's not supposed to be two pieces!)
customer_reviews.author: joe shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great for making hamburgers and stuffed parries too
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a blast using 5 pounds of ground beef to make nice thick patties. Last night I made him Ruben burgers and the thickness of these patties were perfect for topping with the swiss cheese pastrami, sauerkraut and dressing topping.. Next time we are going to make patties with the filling indention to use for the reuben fillng.. Cleaning was a breeze, ease of use is awesome and end result is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine D.

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT Stuffed burgers!
customer_reviews.text: You just fill the meat, press hole, stuff, top meat, compress, remove & cook! I use this all the time! The photos show Bacon, bell pepper, onion, chopped garlic, mushrooms & cheddar cheese. Fat & juicy! Yum! I am able to make two stuffed burgers and one slider with one pound of meat. Each burger is close to 1/2 of meat....and then add the stuffing.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Dale

customer_reviews.title: So press and so clean clean
customer_reviews.text: It was time to grow up. Time for a hamburger press! This works awesome, with three different prep modes. Some people complained about the size of the main burger, but they come out perfect for our family. Not sure what big honkers these people are eating. The sliders work well, too. Haven't tried the stuffed burger option, but looking forward to it. Whoooaaaa good buy!
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Portion Control
customer_reviews.text: This is lightweight plastic, but amazingly sturdy. And it works exactly the way you would expect. And it's dishwasher-proof. And there is not one thing I would change about this burger press. A really helpful companion isbecause these will let you keep those perfectly portioned burgers separated. To answer the obvious question, "Yes, I would buy again and would recommend it to a friend!"
customer_reviews.author: Ray Paseur

customer_reviews.title: Okay product but I won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough but the meat did stick to the inside making it hard to remove. I usually use a bowl with a flat bottom to make burgers constant and that is easier. I will probably use this again, but it won't be my go to. It was hard to get enough filling to taste and keep it sealed so the cheese didn't come out while cooking. Also hard to make an indent in the center so when the burger shrank during cooking it became fat/thick.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: really easy to get the patties out of the press
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this was cheaply made - I was expecting it to be sturdier or made of metal, but then realized it is just great. I can take it apart and wash it in the dishwasher. I buy ground beef and weigh it into 120 g patties. Using this press, I can freeze them in uniform shapes so they can be cooked directly from frozen and all cook evenly. This does the job I wanted it to. I prefer to not use plastic, but I'm taking care with this so hopefully won't need to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Great product for Vegetarians too! Well designed
customer_reviews.text: Just got this, and as my family is veggie burger makers, we thought this would work well for our creations, and it did. We can make whatever we want into a burger- we often use the rolls of soy based burger like meat, add breadcrumbs, some olive oil for days, and stuff with cooked mushrooms and cheese, or peppers and spices...whatever we feel like and this press does a great job, and was really well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: Googly

customer_reviews.title: Not non-stick
customer_reviews.text: I bought this burger maker specifically because it says it's non-stick plastic. It's not. The meat sticks to the bottom plate 90% of the time. I do admit it is better than my old because you can remove the bottom and salvage the burger a little, but it still sticks. On my old one the ring and bottom were all one piece, so it was harder.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Not good design for more than a few stuffed burgers at a time
customer_reviews.text: 4/5 stars for a multi-size burger press in a compact package. 2/5 stars for stuffed burgers - very hard to assemble / dissemble while making more than a a few stuffed burgers with greasy hands. The piece that twists into place becomes difficult to insert & remove for every burger. Much faster to do by hand assembly-line style. Average: 3/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J

customer_reviews.title: Great press but need some other functionality
customer_reviews.text: I really like these burger press. I would make this better by adding weight/size metrics to the product so one may know approx. how big ones burger is. My first time i made burgers with this press i stuff the meat (beef only) nearly to the brim and pressed for what essentially was a burger the size of all available space. I grilled the burgers on medium heat and achieved a great JUICY burger - that fit perfectly on most buns you buy from your local grocery store. The drawback was - I didn't know how much meat i used and when i attempted the next time with half the size it didnt turn out the same.
customer_reviews.author: brandon smith

customer_reviews.title: Straight forward patty maker
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy to use hamburger maker. I've made all three variations, that being the standard patty, the little slider patty and the fun, stuffed burger patty. All patties formed perfectly and were easy to remove from press for cooking. All parts come easily apart and are dishwasher safe. If you make more than a few hamburgers a year, this is a worth while purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A J Saveriano

customer_reviews.title: Burger making is now a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Burger presses are amazing, they not only help with consistency but also make the whole process quicker. This one is so much fun because of all different burger options. We made sliders for the kids and they loved them. The item itself seems like it is high quality, all the pieces are made of a sturdy plastic and they all fit and lock together for east storage.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Bahr

customer_reviews.title: Cool lil gadget for more than just burgers too!!:)
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these and lasted for years so I know this will give me tons of use for years to come!! Make all kinds of great stuff .. stuff burgers ,stuffed meatballs do like burgers but after cut in fours and round out with pinch of extra beef,easy way to add layers of anything u want to get her and bake fry grill boil steam!! I can come up with anything u want just try it out.. I love trying new stiff all the time..believe it or not this thing will help u to make killer ice cream sandwich too.. fill how u like them stick in freezer for about 45 minutes or so and VOILIA!!hahah...get creative!!!
customer_reviews.author: MGS80

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: This is very small for grilling purposes. Aside from the size, the design seems to work fairly well though it is far simpler and faster to make the patties by hand. The only reason I would recommend buying this product is if you desperately wanted to make tiny stuffed sliders or fun-sized specialty burgers for young children.
customer_reviews.author: David & Shannon Thomas

customer_reviews.title: User error?
customer_reviews.text: Eh........ the burgers didn’t stay closed once stuffed and being grilled. Maybe we overstuffed? Maybe we used too much meat? Followed the directions but in the end I doubt we’ll use this again. Made quite a mess when the cheese started melting all over the grill.
customer_reviews.author: C. Weber

customer_reviews.title: tiny burgers
customer_reviews.text: If you want to make sausage and not hamburgers, it will make a great paddy, however, if you want to make a hamburger that will fit in a hamburger bun, this is NOT the press. This needs to be made to twice the size to make a burger that will shrink to a decent size. It works well. It makes "sliders" well.
customer_reviews.author: Rickey  B

customer_reviews.title: Broke After 4th Use
customer_reviews.text: I loved this press for the first three times I used it. The top separated the fourth time I used it and will not lock into place anymore. I am still able to use it as I can press ground meat without the top, but it is more more difficult and not the way it is designed for use. That is the reason I have given it two stars instead of one. To be fair, I have had it for over a year and don't use it that often, but it should have lasted longer than four uses.
customer_reviews.author: S. O'Day

customer_reviews.title: Great Hamburger maker!
customer_reviews.text: With the price of meats going up this works great for making your own hamburgers. Easy to use. Easy to clean. Can make them as thick or thin as you like. Makes slider size burgers too. Also you can add extras into the burgers like bits of bacon or cheese I used wax paper in between the burgers. Then froze them. Ready for the grill whenever you need them
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They are a very simple design but are easy to use and make great burgers. I'm not a fan of "gadgets" and so these are great for me because they do exactly what their supposed to!. I love that you can easily make stuffed burgers and that, as you would expect from Cuisinart, they are sturdy and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Neenah

customer_reviews.title: Good width, really big/tall
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the 4 1/2 part essentially as a mold. It works well for that but, if you fill it up to the top, it's a 1/2 lb burger that can be a little awkward to eat due to how tall the burger is. Will likely continue to use it but only fill it up 1/2-3/4 of the way for something more like a 1/4 to 1/3 lb burger.
customer_reviews.author: M. Svensson

customer_reviews.title: A Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Wanted an easy to use, and clean, burger press- this did not disappoint ! You can make a nice size burger with the larger part, or change it to the smaller one, and make a slider instead. It took looking at the directions, and practicing a few times to get the slider the right size and thickness I want. Easy to clean, I soak it in dish soap and water as soon as I'm done with it.
customer_reviews.author: CC_Rider

customer_reviews.title: Product Works as Expected, Great Burgers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product as a whim to see if stuffed burgers were worth all the hype. Answer? Definitely! This product worked great, was easy to clean. I used it with sheets of parchment paper. The burger was great. I did watch a few videos to make sure I knew what I was doing. I can't wait to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The lock does not function on this hamburger press
customer_reviews.text: This item is good for making regular hamburger patties. Although I was looking forward to trying to make Stuffed Burgers. It says that's what this item is for also it says that it has a Twist lock so grip both pieces and twist 2 release. It does not lock. Is there anything I can do or should you just send me a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent burger press
customer_reviews.text: This gadget worked wonderful. It was easy to use and easy to clean. If you have issues with it sticking I just sprayed with Pam and had no sticking! And some people commented that these burgers are small not sure where they got that from! You can see in the pictures how big they are. Mine were half pound patties and filled the whole bun. If you're thinking about getting one you'll be glad to buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Richdrum1970

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This gets used really often. I buy hamburger in bulk, then make patties, wrap them and put them in the freezer in bags. They are always ready, and I can grab 2 or 4 or however many I need. I like this burger press better than any of them I have used recently. It is very sturdy and the bottom comes out so that the patty comes out perfect every time. It will not break and will last me many years.
customer_reviews.author: et

customer_reviews.title: Quick work of bulk hamburger
customer_reviews.text: This burger press makes easy work of large batches of hamburger meat. We buy bulk quantities and pre make burgers then vacuum seal and freeze. My family follows a low carb diet and stuffing burgers with green olives and pickles makes for a tasty dinner. Be sure to use patty paper between burgers. The more you make the more fat that builds up on the press. Either wash the press once the fat builds up or use the round patty paper in the press.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: awesome product! A must-have for bbq/burger lovers!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that I've purchased. Love it and had to buy one for my buddy as he kept borrowing mines! So many different types of burgers you can make, allows you to be creative. My favorite is ghost pepper/jalapeno/halloumi stuffed burgers ;). The only thing I wish this would come with is a case, as it comes with many pieces. Not a big drawback as you can just buy a small polyester case with strap to fit in.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Hubby is happy. Perfect little patties
customer_reviews.text: Hubby is happy. Perfect little patties. You can't beat the price. Buy the recommended wax wrappers. They make the perfect little party patties.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Daly

customer_reviews.title: It does work!
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well, it needs to be sprayed with something non- stick like Pam. If you did this I think it wild work much better. It was hard to keep the burger from sticking to it the first time I tried it. I did notice in the video after I rewatched it that they had some non-stick spray sitting on the counter. It would have been nice if they noted that in the instructions. It would have all 5 🌟 if it wasn't for the sticking.
customer_reviews.author: rastas

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it for me
customer_reviews.text: I've always made stuffed burgers by hand but I thought I'd try this out and see if it made it any easier or faster. I'm going to say that it probably doesn't. If you have a hard time making your patties the right size by hand, then this could be the answer. My issue is, the hamburger sticks to the surface of the press, so it's hard to get the patties out without taking it apart every time. I'm sure this will vary depending on the fat content of your burger. I'll probably still use it sometimes, it does make them look really uniform and nice. But if I'm in a hurry, I'll just make them by hand.
customer_reviews.author: lmichele

customer_reviews.title: Makes burger making a breeze
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this after he decided we would begin making our own hamburger patties. I have to admit, I was skeptical. Happy to say that we love this product and would recommend it to anyone who’s a party making fan. We’ve used it twice now and gotten the perfect burger - size and thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Andrews

customer_reviews.title: This Burger Press works AMAZINGLY 5⭐️
customer_reviews.text: I was slightly hesitant to purchase , due to some reviewers claiming that patties stuck to the press , or that parchment paper was needed . That is ABSOLUTELY UNTRUE ! This press works like a CHAMP ! Haven’t made stuffed burgers yet but I’m confident that will be just as flawless as this press has already performed. Those pics are of my second batch of burgers . I’ve also read that there is issue with the removable portion of the press cap not staying together when fastened to the press handle . Mine attaches tightly with a “click”. Buy Buy Buy this !
customer_reviews.author: Eric T

customer_reviews.title: Faulty top, otherwise perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of the patties this makes! Everything is perfect, EXCEPT my top lid also breaks into two pieces after pressing each burger. Making me have to scrap part of the lid off each time. If it weren't for the faulty top, this would be perfect 👌
customer_reviews.author: H. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sized burgers
customer_reviews.text: This is great for making burger patties the perfect size as well as making stuffed patties also. But for the life of me I can’t figure out what the small piece is for. Maybe I missed something. Other than that I love it. Comes apart easily to toss in the dish washer.
customer_reviews.author: Just-Mike92

customer_reviews.title: Replaced an older one we accidentally tossed part of
customer_reviews.text: I love this burger press. I was sad when I realized we must have tossed the bottom plate of our old one so I got a new one. It's a little difficult to open the lid of the big press for cleaning, but the press itself is awesome. If you're using ground turkey, spray the press with cooking spray for easy removal (or mix breadcrumbs into the turkey).
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Chancey

customer_reviews.title: The ridges in the bottom plate allows the patty to easily separate. I've used parchment paper to separate patties
customer_reviews.text: Used this several times for burgers (both stuffed and regular). The ridges in the bottom plate allows the patty to easily separate. I've used parchment paper to separate patties. When filled to the top, the burgers are 3/4" thick. With a slice of tomato and lettuce, the overall height of an assembled burger was 3" high. I just wish the press right were 1/2 - 3/4 of an inch wider to cover the larger buns and so the patty's are not so thick.
customer_reviews.author: Leland CTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!  Yard sale fodder.
customer_reviews.text: Falls apart. Sticks to meat. Not wide enough, once the meat shrinks, you end up with sliders or mini sliders. Difficult clean-up, several pockets that attract bacteria. I find it easier to squeeze two half burgers down to 1/8" in between two wet luncheon plates and stuff those, crimping the edge. Comes out cooked nice and wide.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Great for stuffing or just making burger patties
customer_reviews.text: I love this burger press! Whether it's to fill with cheese, bacon, jalapenos or whatever, this is an awesome tool for grilling season! Even if you aren't interested in stuffed burgers, it helps with making burger patties. Burgers are perfectly sculpted and your hands don't get completely covered in raw beef. But be sure to spray some Pam inside the press on the walls and the base, otherwise it's a major pain getting the patty to come loose.
customer_reviews.author: AGonzales7

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect burgers!
customer_reviews.text: I have been making my homemade burgers for YEARS. But never with this little tool. I decided to try it and I love it! My burgers came out so perfect! I love that you can add the cheese inside. I give it four stars because it was a little stiff so it took a little bit to get the hang of it but overall I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Hubby really likes these as he tends to like things to be orderly and symmetrical and this does make very nice looking patties. Great for when we buy large amounts of beef. We weigh out 1/4 lb and press them with this, then put the patties in the freezer with baking paper between them. Then we can just thaw and grill (or put the right amount into a recipe) as needed. Having them be an even size makes them more manageable in the freezer too.
customer_reviews.author: NDinOKC

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to make some normal burger patties on the first use of this item. No matter how much cooking spray or oil I put on the press, the burger meat would always stick to it and I would destroy the patty trying to separate it from the press. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Burger Game Changed Forever
customer_reviews.text: Had a few dollars left for Christmas presents for the hubby, so ordered this to put in his stocking....had no clue it would completely change our burger game! This little press forms burgers to the PERFECT size, burgers always come out juicy and it's wayyy easier than forming them by had. 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emily M.

customer_reviews.title: Get this
customer_reviews.text: Yes yes and yes!!! This makes your burgers perfectly round. I can’t wait to try stuffing some patties sometime.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel D

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly this worked exactly like it was supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Well, surprisingly this worked exactly like it was supposed to! We made a whole host of different kinds of stuffed burgers using this gizmo and vacuum packed and froze them. Just cooked two in the sous vide and it worked perfectly! We got preportioned burgers at Costco meat counter, each patty was a half pound. We weighed out 2/3 and 1/3 of each and made a stuffed burger out of each pair. Final product was about 10oz burgers. Could have used less meat I think.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful1234

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: While this hamburger stuffer works it is poorly designed and doesn't last. The small dimples that lock the 2 pressed parts gave in after making 8 burgers. The large presser no longer locks to the handle/small presser and thus it is not easily removed after pressing a patty. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy John

customer_reviews.title: A must if you are a burger lover!!!
customer_reviews.text: I grind my own meat for fresh burgers and I use the press to add cheeses, mushrooms, bacon, onions....etc. Best we ever ate! Really.........favorite way to cook burgers now. Ease of use and clean up! Ya' gotta get one!
customer_reviews.author: Bultaco

customer_reviews.title: Very cool!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little money saving contraption. My husband and I love burgers- we especially love this burger joint down the road from us that does specialized stuffed burgers. The down side was they were so EXPENSIVE! Burgers down the road cost us $10 a pop, but now with this awesome thing, they cost about a fifth of the price! I advice to use a little oil or non-stick spray on the plastic pieces so that the meat doesn't stick. I have also noticed that making burgers with a combination of beef and pork keeps the burgers from falling apart when you are cooking them.
customer_reviews.author: doejubois

customer_reviews.title: Fun burgers that make you look like a pro
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our 4th of July cookout. They were a hit. PROS: didn't fall apart stuffed well sealed well fun to do CONS: well, they are huge.. but from what I read, this one makes them smaller than the other presses with worst reviews. So just keep in mind you are making a big meat burger Everybody picked their own toppings. It was great. I was worried that it wold take too long or be slow with one patty but it isn't at all. We stuffed with: different cheeses, mushrooms, bacon bits TIP: next time we are going to try to use frozen shredded cheese or maybe the cubes. The cheese melted just a bit too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Matt T

customer_reviews.title: Make better burgers
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best way to make delicious burgers on the grill. This is a much better method than hand forming, they come out perfect every time. they don't balloon, or crumble. It's a cheap plastic circle that I recommend to everyone. and would buy again without a second thought.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: But all in all a really useful tool and made making juicy lucys super easy
customer_reviews.text: Its not as nonstick as I was wanting it. I even sprayed it with Pam and the rivets on the inserts caused it to stick. But all in all a really useful tool and made making juicy lucys super easy. I even got to stuff done burgers with feta cheese crumbles which I haven't been able to do until now. I would but this again. I'm thinking about trying a run down with coconut oil or Crisco to see if that helps it not to stick.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I used to own a Tupperware hamburger patty maker, disappointed that I discarded it. But I am happy to find this one because the hamburger patty is easy to make and easy to remove from the circle due to the removable disc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect burgers!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend one day had an idea to start making our burgers homemade so I bought him this so his burgers come out more consistent. He loves it as well as I do. Really easy to use and clean. To get the burgers into perfect shapes and sizes we use a 1/3 measuring cup and have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Berger Is Easy To Create!
customer_reviews.text: Although you still have to get your hands into the chop meat, and a fair amount of strength is required to use this, it still works great! Making regular burgers are always perfectly formed. Stuffed burgers are easy to make and come out just right!
customer_reviews.author: John Yaeger

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for this price
customer_reviews.text: I was a little confused at first when I bought this, as "non stick coating" to me doesn't necessarily indicate that it is made of thin plastic. I've been using (and been disappointed with) a Weber press for a few years now and wanted to give this a try instead. Don't let the material or looks deceive you--this is a great little burger press. Every burger that I've made with it has come out even, hasn't stuck to the press, and the added options of either doing stuffed burgers or pressing out sliders is a great added bonus. For the price, you can't beat this press.
customer_reviews.author: CRSdefiance

customer_reviews.title: All l
customer_reviews.text: The threads did not do so well. If it did not have the "stuffed press" part of it, I would have liked it more, the threaded part did not lock and would stick to the burger, also near would push pass the press. All plastic, which I also did not like. Used it 3 times over a month, liked the idea but did not the operation.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S.

customer_reviews.title: Great burger press.
customer_reviews.text: Super excited to make hamburgers with this! It seemed really simple but a simple product is all it takes to press delicious home made burgers. Haven’t tried out the stuffed burger function yet but can’t wait to!
customer_reviews.author: Jonee

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the "as seen on TV" version. I was very surprised at how much I love this thing, it works great... If I had one complaint it would be that the merging the top and bottom of the burger takes a little practice. The added slider maker was an added bonus. I get pretty creative with what I stuff into the burgers, try some BBQ pork or some smoked brisket
customer_reviews.author: Eric Norton

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected. I'm very happy with this purchase! Used it tonight and made perfect burgers! I also made some patties, separated them with wax paper and put them in the freezer bags. This will be so convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Pea

customer_reviews.title: Flawed Design
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this product rates so high, but maybe we received a defective one. The handle is supposed to turn to lock onto the burger press, but the teeth are too small to engage. What happens then is the press sticks in the base. Frankly, I believe this a just a poor design. The so-called slider press is just a stand-alone mold. Overall, this is way overpriced for what you get. Instantly returned.
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: Burgers of all sizes!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today, and I loved it. It makes nice, even, thick burgers. I even made a few thin ones for the kids. I love that I can make a regular, stuffed or slider burger. And the plates that slide out make it so easy to remove the patty after it is formed . I still sprayed it down with a little oil, but honestly, I don't know if it was really necessary. This is a great New kitchen gadget.
customer_reviews.author: LeaPina

customer_reviews.title: Easy, simple, great size
customer_reviews.text: Amazing and simple. My husband got these cuz he wanted yummy burgers. He chopped some onions, added olives and in some, stuffed them with Cheese... Best burgers ever. He cooked them in the air frier... He loved how easy it was to use. The size is on the larger side of burgers. Delish!!
customer_reviews.author: FCM

customer_reviews.title: Make the burger of your dreams
customer_reviews.text: This burger press is awesome. A great way to get more creative in the kitchen. As a burger lover this is a life changing tool for the gourmet burger of your dreams. Helps make consistently sized burgers.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Bobbitt

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Works great as long as your don’t get rough with this product. We stuff burgers with crumbled blue Cheese frequently. Fun gadget to use. I recommend a digital scale for sizing burger tops and bottoms
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect patties
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this after reading the reviews. I preferred to buy from a brand I knew so I chose this over the others. I have zero complaints. This works great for both regular patties and stuffed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: all in all in useful
customer_reviews.text: all in all it is useful, yet it sticks if you do not use plastic rap, it also took me time to figure out how to press the filled patty. had to watch a youtube video. it is dishwasher safe which is great
customer_reviews.author: noor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect parties
customer_reviews.text: Makes perfect patties! Great size.. Very easy to use and clean. I have not tried thr stuffed burgers feature yet or the sliders size, but the main feature works excellently!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsiekayt

customer_reviews.title: Help making the burger easier
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to use and clean. Kids are having fun of making dinner with this press. If you make the homemade burgers very often, I recommend you to buy this one, and you won't regard.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, and stores nicely within itself. Makes pressing perfect burgers quick, easy, and consistent for evenly cooked burgers. Easy to clean, and durable construction for the price.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!
customer_reviews.text: easy to use and clean. Easy to store. I use the individual sheets for each burger to keep them from sticking. You can make ahead and freeze and thaw what you need or cook as you go. Makes each burger come out the perfect size. You can make stuffed burgers too!
customer_reviews.author: dona

customer_reviews.title: Easy burgers
customer_reviews.text: Works well for what it's designed. The hardest part is the cap itself comes apart ... I had to mess with it to get it apart. Not a big deal, but could have been better said in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, although ir works well for a while
customer_reviews.text: I like the capability of this press, especially for stuffed burgers, but it is cheaply made. The plastic prongs that hold the two major pieces together for non-stuffed burgers wear very quickly and you cannot hold the pieces together. This renders the press useless. I had to order a new press simply because I have not found one that stuffs a burger as well. I am doomed to buy a new one every year, it seems.
customer_reviews.author: L. S. Brodsky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome press
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this yet to make a stuffed burger, but just a normal burger. It works really well and having the bottom come out is awesome because now the burger doesn't stick to the press. This also makes a perfect shaped burger and you can make it with any amount of burger meat. The handle does not give like others when pressing the burger and you don't feel like you are going to break it. Glad I finally found one of these that I love because it makes burger making so much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Burger Express
customer_reviews.text: Great device that makes hamburgers or turkey burgers both fast and easy. I was able to get ready for a Labor Day party at a much faster time using this hamburger maker.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: It took my burger to another level
customer_reviews.text: It took my burger to another level! It’s easy to use! Easy to clean! Thank t comes with 2 sizes for the regular burgers and another one for the sliders! I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Unbelievable Movie

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy
customer_reviews.text: This is simple and easy, I have an expensive metal plunger one that I have to constantly clean to get it to work, I don't use the metal one any more; I use this one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Gadget is a good addition to well prepared kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Well made press. I've been pattying hamburgers instead of buying patties. This press helps me patty without overworking the ground chuck. Uniform patties cook best.
customer_reviews.author: NKRGMom

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This press works great. And, I discovered a way to make patties ready for freezing with no mess to the press! Just grab a zip lock sandwich baggie. Put a round of meat (I made mine 1/3 pound) in the middle of the baggie. Don't close. Place the baggie in the press and press away. Perfect size burgers ready for freezing. Just shut the baggie and then store the burgers in a freezer storage baggie. This way they are double bagged and will be less likely to get freezer burn. And since they are in individual bags, it's easy to take out as many as you need and return the remainder to the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wetmore

customer_reviews.title: Great value rugged easy to use. Makes great product
customer_reviews.text: Okay this thing is fun makes hamburgers like a boss. I can pack them so tight that they will not fall apart on the grill like hand-made patties. So worth the money
customer_reviews.author: electric mower guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Gadget
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this patty press to use for a large bbq party. I also purchased the square patty papers and highly recommend them to use with this press. It makes the whole process go smoothly and quickly. When you don't use the papers, removing the patty from the press can be time consuming. We made 50 hamburgers in only 20 minutes using a scale to measure the weight ( a quarter pound ) a paper on bottom and one on top. The finished (cooked) patty size is perfect for standard hamburgers buns. I have yet to attempt sliders with this. I have made one stuffed burger, and for that purpose it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. M

customer_reviews.title: Ok... I guess
customer_reviews.text: The handle that is supposed to lock together with the other part of the pressing assembly almost NEVER stays locked. When examining closer it probably has to do with the fact that the channel or groove that it's supposed to lock I to is 1-2 millimeters deep, so it always pops out. Other than that, its ok. It does what it's supposed to... Press burgers.
customer_reviews.author: Alan H

customer_reviews.title: Great For Making English Muffin Sandwiches
customer_reviews.text: I would probably give five stars if it was made of metal. I've made pizza burgers and they turn out fine. You just need to be careful not to use too much hamburger, because they end up really thick. I think using plastic wrap is an great idea, because the food does not stick to the press and clean-up is much easier. Additionally, I like using this press for making breakfast sausage patties. They turn out to be the correct size for an english muffin.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Time consuming
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little getting use to. You can easily put too much in it. I bought this a while back and haven't used it as much as I thought I would. It's good if want to take the time to use/clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Aande

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CSBP-100 3-in-1 Stuffed Burger Press, Black
feature_bullets: Makes stuffed burgers, sliders, and regular burgers
